Study Session 2
Exam Focus
This topic review covers important terms and concepts associated with probability theory.
Random variables, events, outcomes, conditional probability, and joint probability
are described. Probability rules such as the addition rule and multiplication rule are
introduced. These rules are frequently used by finance practitioners. Expected value,
standard deviation, covariance, and correlation for individual asset and portfolio returns
are discussed. A well-prepared candidate will be able to calculate and interpret these
widely used measures. This review also discusses counting rules, which lay the foundation
for the binomial probability distribution that is covered in the next topic review.
